IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SERVE AS A HOME FOR OUTSTANDING ENSEMBLE ACTING AND LIFELONG LEARNING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ROUND HOUSE THEATRE IS A HOME FOR OUTSTANDING ENSEMBLE ACTING AND LIFELONG LEARNING. WE SEEK TO CAPTIVATE AUDIENCES WITH STORIES THAT INSPIRE COMPASSION, EVOKE EMOTIONS, AND DEMAND CONVERSATION.
IRS990.Desc: PERFORMANCE: ROUND HOUSE IS ONE OF THE LEADING PROFESSIONAL THEATRES IN THE WASHINGTON, DC METROPOLITAN AREA. WE PRODUCE A SEASON OF NEW PLAYS, MODERN CLASSICS AND MUSICALS AT OUR THEATRE IN BETHESDA. IN THE 2017-2018 SEASON, WE WELCOMED MORE THAN 60,000 PATRONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION: ROUND HOUSE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS SERVE MORE THAN 4000 STUDENTS OF ALL AGES THROUGH A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS IN OUR EDUCATION CENTER, OUR BETHESDA THEATRE, AND SCHOOLS THROUGH MONTGOMERY COUNTY. OUR PLAY IT FORWARD INITIATIVE INCLUDES: THE TEEN PERFORMANCE COMPANY - A PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH TRAINING AND MENTORSHIP BY RHT ARTISTS AND CULMINATES IN THE SARAH METZGER MEMORIAL PLAY, WHICH IS DIRECTED, DESIGNED, AND PERFORMED BY TPC MEMBERS; APPRENTICESHIPS AND INTERNSHIPS; AND FREE PLAY -FREE TICKETS TO ANY STUDENT AGE 13 THROUGH COLLEGE FOR ANY SHOW. ADDITIONAL EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS INCLUDE: SUMMER CAMP -FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES K-12; DAYS OFF! PLAY IN A DAY; CLASSES FOR YOUTH, TEENS, ADULTS, AND SENIORS; STUDENT MATINEES AND IN-SCHOOL AND AFTER-SCHOOL RESIDENCIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENTS FOR ARTISTIC PROGRAMMING; ALL INCOME EARNED (UP TO 6%) ON THE CORPUS AMOUNT IS AVAILABLE FOR OPERATIONS. THE NET INVESTMENT EARNINGS FROM THE THEATRE'S PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS ARE TO BE USED TO SUPPORT AN ANNUAL HIGH SCHOOL PLAY, ARTISTIC DEVELOPMENT, NEW PLAYS, AND SPECIAL PROGRAMS.

FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE THEATRE HAS DOCUMENTED ITS CONSIDERATION OF FASB ASC 740-10, INCOME TAXES, THAT PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR REPORTING UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED AS AN EXPENSE ON THE 198,560. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON PART VIII, LINE 8C.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED AS AN EXPENSE ON THE 198,560. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON PART VIII, LINE 8C.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY THE OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS AND REVIEWED BY THE ARTISTIC DIRECTOR, MANAGING DIRECTOR, GENERAL MANAGER, AND FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE FULL BOARD WAS PROVIDED A COPY OF THE RETURN BEFORE IT WAS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD AND EACH EMPLOYEE WHO HAS RESPONSIBILITY PERTAINING TO ACTIONS OR TRANSACTIONS BY ROUND HOUSE THEATRE (RHT) THAT MAY INVOLVE A FINANCIAL INTEREST OR OTHER INTEREST COMPLETES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AFFIRMATION ("AFFIRMATION") AS CIRCUMSTANCES WARRANT AS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD, BUT NO LESS FREQUENTLY THAN ANNUALLY. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON DISCLOSES THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL OR OTHER INTEREST AND IS GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR OF THE BOARD. DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR OF THE BOARD REVIEW EACH INTERESTED PERSON'S AFFIRMATION AND ANY OTHER DISCLOSURES REGARDING THE FINANCIAL INTEREST OR OTHER INTEREST OF THE INTERESTED PERSON. AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE FINANCIAL OR OTHER INTEREST, THE INTERESTED PERSON LEAVES THE MEETING WHILE THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR OF THE BOARD DISCUSS AND VOTE ON WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. AFTER EXERCISING DUE DILIGENCE, THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR BOARD DETERMINE WHETHER RHT CAN OBTAIN WITH REASONABLE EFFORT A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT FROM A PERSON OR ENTITY THAT WOULD NOT PRODUCE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF IT HAS DETERMINED THAT A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS ALTERNATIVE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS NOT REASONABLY FEASIBLE, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR BOARD DETERMINES BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS WHETHER THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF RHT, FOR ITS OWN BENEFIT, AND FAIR AND REASONABLE. BASED ON THESE DETERMINATIONS, THE DISINTERESTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OR BOARD DECIDE WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION OF THE ARTISTIC DIRECTOR AND MANAGING DIRECTOR WAS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE BOARD REVIEWED COMPENSATION AT COMPARABLE ENTITIES. THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION OF THE BOARD WAS DOCUMENTED IN THE MEETING MINUTES. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW TOOK PLACE IN FEBRUARY 2018. THE ARTISTIC DIRECTOR AND MANAGING DIRECTOR, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD, DETERMINE OTHER STAFF COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
